title: US 175 Freeway Removal

pageHeader.title: S.M. Wright Freeway Removal
pageHeader.subTitle: A new boulevard will replace it

text:
The new connection to Interstate 45 opened in July 2020. Work could then start on the freeway removal. The freeway is being replaced with a six-lane, architecturally-enchanced boulevard.

These images start at the south end and proceed northward.

images.caption: Looking north at Elsie Faye Heggins street. The overpass and embankment are removed, and the pavement for the replacement street is in place.
Looking north at Pine Street. The overpass and embankment are removed.
The freeway was still open going northbound north of Pine Street in June 2021.
Going northbound on the freeway main lanes. The southbound lanes at this location are permanently closed.
The next crossing is at Metropolitan Avenue. This overpass is still intact. It is in use by northbound traffic but is closed to southbound traffic.
Driving northbound on the main lanes. Ahead the closure of the southbound lanes is visible. This view features an old design light fixture with support rods.
In the southbound direction, traffic is forced to exit at the Metropolitan Avenue exit.
Looking north, north of Metropolitan Avenue
The Pennsylvania Avenue overpass remains intact and is still in use by both directions of traffic in June 2021.
